SEARCH
Package uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop

Class ImageUtil

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop.ImageUtil
public final class ImageUtil extends Object
Utility class for loading and manipulating images used in the railway simulation. This class provides methods to load images from files, create placeholder images, and rotate images.

All images in the simulation are sized to a standard dimension defined by SIZE (32x32 pixels). This class cannot be instantiated as it only provides static utility methods.

Example Usage:

 // Load an image with a fallback placeholder
 BufferedImage trackImage = ImageUtil.loadImage("images/track_horizontal.png", Color.GRAY, "TRK");
 
 // Create a placeholder image directly
 BufferedImage placeholder = ImageUtil.createPlaceholder(Color.BLUE, "WATER");
 
 // Rotate an image 90 degrees
 BufferedImage rotated = ImageUtil.rotate90Degrees(trackImage);
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • SIZE

      public static final int SIZE
      The standard size (width and height) for all images in pixels. All cell graphics in the simulation are 32x32 pixels.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • createPlaceholder

      public static BufferedImage createPlaceholder(Color fill, String text)
      Creates a placeholder image with the specified fill color and text. Placeholder images are used when the actual image file cannot be loaded.

      The placeholder is a colored square with a dark gray border and white text centered in the middle.

      Parameters:
      fill - the background color for the placeholder (uses MAGENTA if null)
      text - the text to display on the placeholder (can be null or empty)
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage sized to SIZE x SIZE pixels

    • loadImage

      public static BufferedImage loadImage(String filename, Color fallbackColor, String fallbackText)
      Loads an image from a file or resource. If the file is not found or cannot be loaded, returns a placeholder image instead.

      This method tries multiple strategies to load images, ensuring it works both in development (filesystem) and when packaged in a JAR (resources):

      1. Load as a classpath resource (works in JAR files) - looks in resources/ folder
      2. Load from the "src/" directory (development mode - legacy support)
      3. Load from the current directory (fallback)
      4. Create a placeholder if all methods fail

      Note: Images should be placed in the resources/images/ directory and referenced with the "images/" prefix, e.g., "images/grass.png".

      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the image file to load (e.g., "images/track.png")
      fallbackColor - the color to use for the placeholder if loading fails
      fallbackText - the text to display on the placeholder if loading fails
      Returns:
      the loaded image, or a placeholder if loading fails

    • rotate90Degrees

      public static BufferedImage rotate90Degrees(BufferedImage image)
      Rotates an image 90 degrees clockwise. This is useful for reusing track images in different orientations.

      For example, a horizontal track image can be rotated 90 degrees to create a vertical track image.

      Parameters:
      image - the image to rotate
      Returns:
      a new BufferedImage rotated 90 degrees clockwise

    • rotateDegrees

      public static BufferedImage rotateDegrees(BufferedImage image, int degrees)
      Rotates an image by the specified number of degrees clockwise.

      This method supports rotations at any angle, but works best with multiples of 90 degrees (0, 90, 180, 270). The output dimensions are adjusted for 90 and 270 degree rotations (width and height are swapped).

      Parameters:
      image - the image to rotate
      degrees - the number of degrees to rotate clockwise (e.g., 0, 90, 180, 270)
      Returns:
      a new BufferedImage rotated by the specified degrees
